column2: This character is an unholy vampire, immortal and free from disease, but hated by all but their own kin.
This character bears the blood of the wolf, undying and powerful, but cursed with a savage, bestial form that emerges when the moon is full.
This abomination is risen from the dead, and has no goals but to devour the flesh of men.
Entombed and preserved long ago by the Egyptians, some force has brought this corpse back to life.
Said to be made from fire as men were made from clay, these beings have many powers, though they usually do not meddle in human affairs.
This character is imbued with divine power. Immortal and powerful beyond most human imagination, these beings are literal gods among men.
This character was not directly born of a god, but some of that powerful blood still remains.
While not a true god, this character possesses a substantial amount of divine blood. Demi-gods may not live forever, but they are a cut above other men in almost every way.
This child has shown signs of sharing the blood of the wolf. It cannot fully transform, but in time its full powers will awaken.
This child is the spawn of a vampire. It is not yet above diseases and even death, but will mature in time.
This character is the child of a giant and a non-giant. An imposing sight, though perhaps not as tactful as most, half-giants are formidable opponents in combat.
This character is a mighty dragon, powerful and capable of living eternally. Dragons are wise, persuasive, and have a particular fondness for hoarding wealth.
This character, though human, bears the blood of dragons and a small portion of their strength and wisdom.
This character is the leader of the resurrected Legion of Solomon.
This character has found the legendary Philosopher's Stone. Not only does the substance facilitate transmutation, but it extends the life of its holder indefinitely.
This character has dedicated his life to the eradication of all monstrous creatures.
The Novice Mage has dabbled in the arcane, but never learned much.
The Eldritch Scholar is well-versed in the wizarding arts, and can perform a range of spells.
Few powers elude the Veteran Wizard, but their exercise takes a toll on the body.
The Arcane Master is a wizard of unparralleled power. This character can perform miraculous feats, though at great cost.
Twice over the height of men and tougher as well, the northern Giants are a fearsome sight in combat, though they lack the wisdom of common men.
Sharing much of their theology with Catholics, but worshipping the fallen archangel Lucifer instead of The Holy Trinity, Satanists are despised throughout the Christian world.
A very loosely organized belief system centered around spirits and magic, the dark rituals of Voodoo are largely feared throughout the world.

The ancient Egyptians worshipped a pantheon of gods including Ra, Osiris, and Anubis. While their religion was loosely defined and not highly uniform, it remained dominant in Egypt for over 3,000 years before the common era.

The ancient Egyptians worshipped a pantheon of gods including Ra, Osiris, and Anubis. While their religion was loosely defined and not highly uniform, it remained dominant in Egypt for over 3,000 years before the common era.

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.

The Hellenistic religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Zeus, Aries, Athena, and Poseidon. It originated in ancient Greece and with the conquests of Alexander the Great and the Roman Empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the Mediterranean world until the rise of Christendom.
column3:
La religion hellénique est polythéiste, avec un panthéon de douze dieux majeurs dont Jupiter, Mars, Mercure, Venus, Minerve et Vesta. Elle puise ses origines dans la Grèce antique et, grâce aux conquêtes d'Alexandre le Grand et l'Empire romain, elle a pu devenir la religion dominante en Méditerrannée jusqu'à l'avènement du Christianisme. Dans le jeu : 
§Y*§! Peut déclarer des guerres d'assujettissement contre les autre païens
§Y*§! Les souverains ne peuvent pas déclarer de guerres saintes
§Y*§! Capacité de conversion plus faible et vulnérable aux tentatives de conversion par les missionnaires non païens
column4:
Die hellenische Religion ist polytheistisch mit einem Pantheon von zwölf Hauptgöttern, zu welchen Jupiter, Mars, Merkur, Venus, Minerva und Vesta gehören. Sie entstammt dem alten Griechenland und wurde durch die Eroberungen Alexander des Großen und des römischen Reiches wurde sie zur Hauptreligion im Mittelmeerraum, bis zum Aufkommen des Christentums. Besondere Eigenschaften im Spiel: 
§Y*§! Kann Unterwerfungskriege gegen alle anderen Heiden führen
§Y*§! Anführer können keinen heiligen Krieg erklären
§Y*§! Unterlegen beim Bekehren und anfällig für nicht-heidnische Missionare
column6:
La religión helenística es politeista, con un panteón de doce Dioses mayores incluyendo Júpiter, Marte, Mercurio, Venus, Minerva y Vesta. Se originó en la antigua Grecia y, con las conquistas de Alejandro Magno y el Imperio Romano, se convirtió en la religión predominante en el Mediterráneo hasta el auge del Cristianismo. Características definitorias en el juego: 
§Y*§! Puede declarar guerras de subyugación contra todos los demás paganos
§Y*§! Los gobernantes no pueden declarar Guerras Santas
§Y*§! Tasa inferior de conversión y vulnerable a los misioneros de religiones no paganas.

column2: Brythonic paganism is one of the last surviving branch of the ancient druidic belief systems. It features a pantheon of gods and a world full of spirits in which the children of Don rule the Skies, the Earth and the Otherworld. The main gods are Don and Lud, parents of the gods, Beli, the god of Healing, the Great Queen Rhiannon, the Horned god, called Amanaeth, Manawydan, the Sea God and Lleu of the Skillful Hand.

The reformed brythonic faith has a standardized liturgy etched on the many raised stones on the British Isles, telling the story of Don and her children. It is led by the circle of the Druids with the Arch-Druid as the religious leader of the faithful.

The Draconic faith is similar to many forms of European paganism and shares many legends and myths with them. However, unlike the other faiths which worship the great heroes of men in these tales, it venerates the dragons. Legendary serpents such as Nidhogg and Jormungandr are revered ad deities, and fire is viewed as a sacred healer and cleanser of evil.

The reformed draconic faith has standardized texts and rituals, written by dragons which had previously not concerned themselves with books to spread a zealous faith to a growing population and perhaps even gain some human followers. Its primary god is Jormungandr, the world-serpent, said to live in the sea and encircle the entire world.
Offer [Root.GetTitledFirstName] the dark gift of vampirism. This offer may not be received well by God's faithful, but your prisoners will be unable to refuse.
Offer [Root.GetTitledFirstName] with the blood of the wolf. This offer may not be received well by God's faithful, but your prisoners will be unable to refuse.
Heed Lucifer's call and join the fold of your kind's true faith.
Brew a potion for your spouse with which to spice your marriage.
Attempt to craft gold from other materials.
Summon an army of ethereal beings to help you win this war.
Cast an aura around yourself to make others more agreeable.
This character has taken actions that make the public begin to suspect that true and monstrous evil is afoot...
Purge all satan-worshippers from the realm.
Welcome the respectible followers of Lucifer back into our realm.
Set this land ablaze with dragonfire.
Dragons have burned this land recently.
Dragons have burned this land recently.
Go on a great quest, sure to be the grandest of your life.
You have established an entire kingdom for your kin - it may finally be safe to live freely and openly among your people.
You have established an entire kingdom for your kin - it may finally be safe to live freely and openly among your people.
This swarm of godless undead is fatal without fail. Every man bitten becomes another beast and joins the horde.
Has recently issued a challenge for dominance of the empire and cannot do so again for 5 years.
Has recently cast a spell and must wait before performing any more magic.
This character has been on a grand quest, and cannot do so again.
This character bears the legendary golden fleece, granting a more illustrious rule.
This character bears the head of the legendary gorgon Medusa, a fearsome and deadly sight on the fields of battle.
This character exudes a friendly aura.
This character exudes a persuasive aura.
This character exudes a powerfully persuasive aura.
This character has expelled all Luciferians from the realm.
Stake your life on a battle to rule your kin.
This character has summoned a magical owl as a companion.
This character has summoned a magical rat as a companion.
This character has summoned a magical crow as a companion.
This character has summoned a magical wolf as a companion.
This character has summoned a magical dove as a companion.
was burned to death in dragon fire
was turned to stone by a gorgon's gaze
[This.GetTitledFirstName] spends time on magical pursuits, enhancing their power and reducing their negative side-effects.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is raised to be inquisitive and question all facets of existence.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is educated in the mystical arts, preparing to become a true mage.
The citadel is the highest and strongest part of the castle system, a worthy place for the vampire aristocracy to live in.
One of the biggest citadel ever built, truly a monument to the might of the vampires.
Catacombs are used as a burial site, but vampires use these tombs to draw the powers of the undead.
The fighting pits are huge circular arenas that provide the citizens and visitors with entertainment.
The hunting lodge is a schloss that served to kill the lust of the ruler and his entourage by hunting in the area.
Arena is the place where giants honed their skills, as to be ready for the next raid on the small people.
A entire hall dedicated glorification of formidable foes slayed by giant blades.
It served as a house for the King and his kin, a meeting hall for the King and his advisors, and a gathering hall.
The temple in which the gods live and where the common folk worship them.
A small cave where dragons store their treasure.
The treasure cave is the place where dragons amass all their wealth, it is usualy the best protected part of their realm.
A small tower form which the dragons could see their surroundings.
From the top of the tower the dragon could see all of its realm and in case of need protect it.
A huge tower that allowed the dragon to see beyond their realm and all possible invasions that could be coming.
The place where mages learn how to pratice their craft.
The biggest libraries where own by mages and their secrets, inside of them lies so much knowledge that if a regular human where to try to study it all, it would require centuries.
The citadel is the highest and strongest part of the castle system, a worthy place for the vampire aristocracy to live in.
One of the biggest citadel ever built, truly a monument to the might of the vampires.
Catacombs are used as a burial site, but vampires use these tombs to draw the powers of the undead.
The fighting pits are huge circular arenas that provide the citizens and visitors with entertainment.
The hunting lodge is a schloss that served to kill the lust of the ruler and his entourage by hunting in the area.
Arena is the place where giants honed their skills, as to be ready for the next raid on the small people.
A entire hall dedicated glorification of formidable foes slayed by giant blades.
It served as a house for the King and his kin, a meeting hall for the King and his advisors, and a gathering hall.
The temple in which the gods live and where the common folk worship them.
A small cave where dragons store their treasure, blood and treasure.
The treasure cave is the place where dragons amass all their wealth, it is usualy the best protected part of their realm.
A small tower form which the dragons could see their surroundings.
From the top of the tower the dragon could see all of its realm and in case of need protect it.
A huge tower that allowed the dragon to see beyond their realm and all possible invasions that could be coming.
The place where mages learn how to pratice their craft.
The biggest libraries were owned by mages to store their many secrets. Inside of them lies so much knowledge that if a regular human were to try to study it all, it would require centuries.

Long before the renaissance, when the old gods were still strong and the world was not so well known, men of myth and magic still walked the Earth, though their deeds are now forgotten. Giants roamed in the north, undying men with the blood of wolves and bats inspired the fear of the world, and some dabbled in the mystical arts. Through the ages their history became legend, and legend became myth, but in another time, they might instead thrive.

Long before the renaissance, when the old gods were still strong and the world was not so well known, men of myth and magic still walked the Earth, though their deeds are now forgotten. Giants roamed in the north, undying men with the blood of wolves and bats inspired the fear of the world, and some dabbled in the mystical arts. Through the ages their history became legend, and legend became myth, but in another time, they might instead thrive.

Chief and first among the wolfmen, Velnias leads his small clan as they struggle to survive in a world that fears and does not understand them. Some say the blood of the wolf is a curse, but it may prove to be a blessing...

Brynjolf is among the last few of the old and simple race of giants. His people were made into myths and hunted nearly to extinction by the Northmen who feared them as evil gods, and now they scrape out a living in the far northern mountains, waiting for their chance to return.

The infamous Vlad the Impaler was known for his brutality. To strike fear into the hearts of his enemies, he made examples of entire towns, impaling the villagers on spikes for all to see. But some say his cruelty was more than just malice, and that he not only killed, but was an undead abomination himself that fed upon the blood of the living. Was he cursed by God... or blessed by the Devil?

As Christianity spread throughout Europe, it brought with it teachings that minimized or even demonized the magical arts. As the years passed, court wizards faded into obscurity and no longer had the trust of their Lords. Rhodric is one of few left who still believe in them, and even has some magical talents of his own..

Argos of Achaia is a proud man who believes in faith and tradition. His family through the generations watched as Rome adopted Christianity, then split in two and has declined ever since. In Argos' mind, this is no coincidence, and he strives to return to the traditional Greek faith. Will he relent and pray to the God of his Basileus, or press even harder to return to the glory of the past?

The dragons were once a proud and prolific race, respected for their wisdom and feared for their strength. Over the ages, fear won over respect, and men betrayed and hunted down the mythical beasts whose corpses now litter the world. "Dragonslayers" were praised as heroes, while their victims were condemned as monsters. Rugarth and his family are the only dragons left in the world, on an island so cut off from it that they and the humans there live in peace.
Ever since you insulted that shaman on the streets, you've been feeling deathly ill, and a hunger like none you've ever experienced...
As you succumb to the hunger and lose your last ounce of humanity, you know that just as you led in life, so too shall you lead in death.
As the curse drains your mind, so too does it drain your faith. You find that you no longer believe in anything but whatever force brought you back from the grave.
The gods have no power here.
With our recent success, the horde grows in size, and our enemies' dead rise up to join us.
As your realm and your body crumbles to the plague, you join your join your strength to the all-consuming horde.
As an immortal, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier. You awaken today feeling wiser and stronger than ever before.
Success! The potion worked marvelously, and your love life seems better already.
Failure! Not only has the potion failed to induce any romance, but it seems to have had some... unintended consequences.
Success! You have done what was thought to be impossible and turned iron into gold.
You set out to turn iron into gold, but it seems you've somehow managed to turn all of the gold into iron.
The ethereal army has arrived just as planned. Your other soldiers are somewhat ill at ease, but you simply tell them that the ghosts are their ancestors to put their fears to rest.
The ethereal army was summoned successfully, but it seems to be fighting for the wrong side.
A strange army of what appears to be ghosts has materialized near your forces. At first your men were terrified, but they seem to be friendly.
In your travels, you've noticed that everyone you meet outside your realm is incredibly tiny. Or perhaps you and your folk are just very large.
As the horde spreads over your realm and you are finally defeated, you succumb to the plague yourself.
In the bedchamber last night, you found yourself so excited that your more bestial side may have emerged for a moment.
In the bedchamber last night, you seemed to regain the desire of your younger days. Some biting may have been involved.
The filthy peasants are up in arms! They say they refuse to be ruled by a monster.
The local peasants have revolted! They're outraged that our ruler is a savage monster.
The Egyptians have many tombs in which they buried their ancestors. Tales say they buried many riches as well.
We should not disturb these graves.
It has been weeks since the explorers set out to the tombs in search of wealth, but they have not returned.
Perhaps it would be best to leave it be.
Our explorers have returned, having plundered the Egyptian tombs and bringing with them as much gold as they could carry.
The new explorers were never heard from again, and in their place the very dead that occupied the tombs have risen to fight back!
After millenia of slumber, you have returned and taken back the kingdom that is rightfully yours.
Though your crippling injury might have been fatal for normal men, for one of the wolf, even the worst of wounds heal with time.
Common men may struggle with injuries for ages and remain scarred forever. An immortal such as yourself need not worry about such things.

Last night was a full moon, and though you tried to restrain yourself, you became the wolf again and broke free of your chambers. While you don't remember exactly what happened, you fear your court is a head smaller today.

Legends say that the great king Solomon once held a powerful ring that allowed him great powers. Some say he could even command a legion of djinn to do his bidding. The man who possessed this ring would be powerful indeed.
Despite your men's best efforts, no sign has yet been uncovered of this powerful ring of Solomon. Some doubt it even exists.
At last! Your men return from their quest and hand you the legendary Seal of Solomon. As you place it on your finger, you know that your kingdom's power will know no bounds.
As one of the Djinn, you excell in what mortal men would call magic. While some such men dabble in these arts, your powers go beyond what they will ever achieve.
Common men may struggle with weakness and remain feeble forever. An immortal such as yourself need not worry about such things.
Your mind had grown weak, and lesser men said it would last forever. As an immortal, you know that nothing is eternal... except perhaps yourself.
You realize upon reflection that your parents are of dramatically different heights, and find yourself somewhere in between.
As your sire was, so too shall you be. You may not be as powerful for now, but you will be a true vampire in time.
As you reach maturity, so too do your powers. You are now a true vampire.
As your sire was, so too shall you be. You may not be as powerful for now, but you will be a true werewolf in time.
As you reach maturity, so too do your powers. You are now a true werewolf.
You now lead Solomon's Legion, and can truly call yourself as great as King Solomon himself.
You have lost control of Solomon's Legion, and all of the prestige that goes with it.

With your recent successes in alchemy, you've gained an interest in the legendary Philosopher's Stone. It is said that it not only allows easy transmutation, but can even make one immortal. While the secrets to crafting it have long been lost, rumors have reached you of fragments buried with long-dead wizards. With enough of these, you could re-forge a whole Stone.
Your men have returned empty-handed. The graves they dug up were filled only with useless relics and bones.
Perhaps it is a waste of time.

Success! Your men returned with enough pieces of the material that you were able to assemble the Philosopher's Stone. As you first hold it in your hands, you know that untold wealth and power will be yours for all time.
The spell was cast successfully, and already your errant followers begin to appreciate the true faith.
The devil-worshippers have been expelled from our holy realm. We hope to never see their kind again.

With the rise of ungodly monsters laying waste to the world, an increasing number of men loyal to the church have begun to organize against them. A Dutch scholar by the name of Van Helsing has founded an order of knights for these so called monster hunters, in the hopes that they might fight back against the growing hordes of demons.
After spending many weeks with your fellow knights training in ways to hunt the demons of the world, you feel you can truly call yourself a monster hunter.
You have founded an empire of immortals, and named yourself Archsire as first among them. Henceforth, the oldest of the vampires shall rule them all.

One of your subjects, an arrogant pup who thinks himself strong, has dared to challenge you in single combat for rule of the wolves. The duel is to the death, but refusing it would make you seem a coward.
As expected, your liege has accepted your challenge. You will battle him in two weeks time.
He will die like the dog he is.
Your liege has refused your right to challenge him, dishonoring himself in the process.
That coward will pay for this!
The duel begins at sunset. You and your opponent shift forms as the moon rises over the night sky, both knowing that only one will see tomorrow.
Pause, and wait for your opponent to move.

Your opponent lunges at you quickly, and you move to deflect the strike. Too late, you realize that the attack was a feint, and you soon find sharp teeth in your neck. You are flung to the ground, bleeding badly and unable to retaliate any longer.
Your opponent lunges at you quickly but hastily. You deftly deflect the attack, and send him several paces behind you with his own momentum, giving you a chance to strike back.
Pause, and wait for your opponent to move.
Your opponent pauses in the combat, awaiting your move.
Wait for him to strike first.
Your attack was successful! You tear out half of your opponent's throat in a lunge at his neck, and he now lies defeated and bleeding heavily beneath you.
Your opponent has defeated you utterly, and deals you the killing blow as you are helpless to resist.
It was a battle worthy of the greatest of warriors.
Your parents are gods, and so shall you be.
As you grow older, you realize that you are different from other children: stronger, faster, and even wiser. You wonder why this is, but try not to question your gifts too heavily.
Perhaps I am more than a man...
Your wife has told you a strange tale. She recounts how last night as she was going for a walk, a beautiful swan appeared to her. Unable to resist its charms, she spent the night in its embrace.
You recall a strange dream last night in which a beautiful swan appeared to you and seduce you. Of course, you pass off this dream as mere nonsense.
You have assembled your party and made all preparations. Now you need only decide to where your quest will take you.
I shall seek the golden fleece.
I shall slay the legendary gorgon, Medusa.
On second thought, these quests sound dangerous.

You have followed rumors of the fleece to a remote land across the Black Sea. An old man, claiming to be king in these lands, tells you that he posesses it, and will give it to you only if you should pass three arduous trials, any of which may claim your life.

You arrive at the first of your trials, where you are told you must plow a field. You rejoice at the trial's ease when you see two oxen ready to pull your plow, until you realize that the oxen are ablaze with magical fire.
I must tame these unholy beasts!

You return from the field, singed but alive. The old man tells you that you must now sow the same field, and hands you what he claims are dragon's teeth to sow. Reluctantly, you spread them throughout the field. To your horror, an army of soldiers soon sprouts from the ground and moves against you.
To arms, men! We must repel these demons!
Cast a stone amongst them to confuse the host.

The battle was fierce, but you eventually emerge victorious. The old man, who you've come to resent, takes you to a large cave and tells you that the fleece awaits within. You enter, and find that he speaks the truth... but a dragon stands guard in front of it.
Attempt to steal the fleece from the dragon.
Persuade the dragon that you are a worthy bearer of the fleece.

Your stone causes chaos among the ranks of your enemy, causing them to turn on one another. You make quick work of those that remain. The old man takes you to a large cave and tells you that the fleece awaits within. You enter, and find that he speaks the truth... but a dragon stands guard in front of it.
Attempt to steal the fleece from the dragon.
Persuade the dragon that you are a worthy bearer of the fleece.
As if the burns from the oxen weren't enough, the dragonfire stings hot as you quickly snatch the fleece and flee the cave. You are victorious, though some of your men were not so lucky.

You speak with the dragon for hours, discussing many topics and even enjoying yourself in the process. Night has fallen when the dragon decides that you are indeed worthy of the fleece, which it hands to you and bids you good fortune.
The fleece is mine at last.
You arrive at the supposed location of Medusa, a hideous gorgon whose very gaze is said to turn men to stone.
This beast cannot be suffered to live.
On second thought, it sounds like a frightening creature.

You enter the beast's lair, and see evidence of its horrible powers. Unbelivably life-like statutes of men litter the cavern, and reflective steel lines several walls, perhaps to allow the beast to find its prey more easily. You see movement on the far side of the room.
Close your eyes and attempt to fight the beast.
Use the mirrored walls to fight the beast without looking directly at it.
The fight is difficult without the benefit of your sight, but you eventually succeed in killing the hideous gorgon. You take its head as a prize, careful not to look at it while you do so.
Another fell beast removed from the world.

Using the walls, you find the monster stalking you from behind a pillar. Remarkably, it doesn't seem to notice the same technique, and you surprise it, severing its head in a single blow. Careful not to meet even its dead gaze, you take the head as a trophy.
You had your fun last night, but it may not be without consequence.
It has been a long time since you indulged your carnal desires. You decide to head down to the realm of mortals for some fun.
Only one of your parents is a dragon, so you get to be dragonborn.

Some local human peasants have come to you complaining that you've been flying around eating their farm animals and burning their lands. You try to explain that no dragon could be expected not to do these things, but they don't seem convinced.
Assure them that you'll try to be more prudent in the future.
You've noticed that your hoard of wealth is meager even by human standards, and this ill-befits a dragon such as yourself.
Exact a special tax on your vassals.
You've received a strange letter from [From.GetTitledFirstName] in which he claims to be an immortal and powerful vampire. Stranger still, the letter contains an offer to share this "gift!"
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer and gladly accepts it.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with a regretful decline.
They don't know what they're missing.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with vehement scorn and plans to expose you as a monster to the world!

You've received a strange letter from [From.GetTitledFirstName] in which he claims to be an immortal and powerful werewolf (whatever that is). Stranger still, the letter contains an offer to share this "gift!"
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer and gladly accepts it.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with a regretful decline.
They don't know what they're missing.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with vehement scorn and plans to expose you as a monster to the world!
As a werewolf, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier. You awaken today feeling wiser and stronger than ever before.
As a dragon, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier, and your long experience ruling shows over younger peers. You awaken today feeling wiser than ever before.
One of your parents was born of a god, and some part of that powerful blood flows on in you.
Over the months since conquering this region, numerous civilians have resisted the horde. Now they have faded into obscurity, and most have been turned or wiped out.

In the months since retaking this province from the undead plague, your troops have worked hard to hunt down and exterminate any remnants of it. Finally you can claim some success, and braver colonists from your homeland have begun to move into the now-empty homes and castles here.
You lead an army of undead and there are no limits to your authority.

You have spent much time honing your magical skills, but have realized that they could be taken even further. Summoning a familiar could raise your potential to new heights, though the process could be costly and time consuming.
Your attempt to summon a familiar was a success! You now have a new magical companion to aid you.
Your attempt to summon a familiar was a failure! Despite months of effort, you're left with nothing but a disturbing pile of mixed animal parts on your summoning table.
Uh... someone clean this up, please.
Lesser men may be ridden with disease, but your kind need not be bothered by such things.
You are Zeus, God-King of Olympus, and you have achieved all anyone could dream of. Except perhaps a few more pleasures of Earthly flesh...
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, but it didn't go very well.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and the effort was more or less successful.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and it paid off well.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and you excelled in every way.
